alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Butler; Clarion; Venango (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 1:50PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN VENANGO...NORTHERN BUTLER...NORTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG AND WEST CENTRAL CLARION COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 149 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Slippery Rock, or 9 miles southeast of Grove City, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Knox, Emlenton, St. Petersburg, Eau Claire, Foxburg, Cherry Valley, Boyers, and Cranberry Township. This includes Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 36 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northwestern and west central Pennsylvania.
